definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Adopt safe low voltage to guarantee the safety of human life.
sentences.chinese: 采用安全低电压，保证人身安全。

sentences.english: He also said his personal safety was in jeopardy.
sentences.chinese: 他还说自己的人身安全处于险境。

sentences.english: Myphone rang with callers making threats against my life.
sentences.chinese: 我收到很多电话恐吓我的人身安全。

sentences.english: But he said no one at the dinner was ever in danger.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他表示晚宴全体人员人身安全均未受到威胁。

sentences.english: The next need, a level higher, is physical safety;
sentences.chinese: 高一层的需求为人身安全。

sentences.english: Workshop, ensure safety sign with the personal safety of the operator.
sentences.chinese: 车间内设安全标志，确保操作人员的人身安全。

sentences.english: In today’s world, your personal security is largely your financial security.
sentences.chinese: 在现今世界，人身安全很大程度上取决于财务安全。

sentences.english: Men die earlier, so we get to cash in on the life insurance.
sentences.chinese: 男人普遍死得早，所以我们可以拿到人身安全保险。

sentences.english: This year’s theme is the safety of journalists.
sentences.chinese: 今年的主题是保护记者人身安全。

sentences.english: What's more, the increasing of social unrests threatens the personal safety of little children.
sentences.chinese: 社会不安定因素增多，威胁幼儿人身安全。

definition: to endanger/to jeopardize/a danger (to life, national security etc)
